description: Borrowed from Latin extractum, neuter perfect passive participle of extrahō, from ex- (“out of”) +‎ trahō (“I drag”).

entries.meaning: Something that is extracted or drawn out.
A portion of a book or document, incorporated distinctly in another work; a citation; a quotation.
examples: I used an extract of Hemingway's book to demonstrate culture shock.

entries.meaning: A decoction, solution, or infusion made by drawing out from any substance that which gives it its essential and characteristic virtue
Any substance extracted is such a way, and characteristic of that from which it is obtained
examples: quinine is the most important extract of Peruvian bark.

entries.meaning: A solid preparation obtained by evaporating a solution of a drug, etc., or the fresh juice of a plant (distinguished from an abstract).
(obsolete) A peculiar principle (fundamental essence) once erroneously supposed to form the basis of all vegetable extracts.
A draft or copy of writing; a certified copy of the proceedings in an action and the judgment therein, with an order for execution.

verbs.description: extract (third-person singular simple present extracts, present participle extracting, simple past extracted, past participle extracted or (archaic) extraught)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To draw out; to pull out; to remove forcibly from a fixed position, as by traction or suction, etc.
examples: to extract a tooth from its socket, a stump from the earth, or a splinter from the finger

entries.meaning: (transitive) To withdraw by expression, distillation, or other mechanical or chemical process. Compare abstract (transitive verb).
examples: to extract an essential oil from a plant

entries.meaning: (transitive) To take by selection; to choose out; to cite or quote, as a passage from a book.
examples: I have thought it proper to extract out of that pamphlet a few of those notorious falsehoods.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To select parts of a whole
examples: We need to try to extract the positives from the defeat.

entries.meaning: (transitive, arithmetic) To determine (a root of a number).
examples: Please extract the cube root of 27.
